legend:
Client Name
Format: #1 - Client Acceptance Checklist
Created on: 1-Apr-18
Next Review: Ongoing for any material changes that will impact this checklist
References: SQC 1 - Integrity of Client, Team Competence, Ethical Requirements
This checklist needs to be filled up at the time of client Acceptance. This includes acceptance of clients with a track record and newly incorporated enterprises as well. In case of a new entity, the evaluation may be done with reference to other entities in the same group etc or with reference to the promoters' history. In case of independence, familiarity or advocacy threats, the auditor should adopt appropriate safeguards in accepting the engagement or not accept the engagement at all

data.CRITERIA: TONE AT THE TOP
Are there any issues that come to our attention on integrity issues with the entity or its management
Are there any significant matters relating to the reputation of the client including but not limited to business practices, litigation, statutory violations, criminal offences etc
Aggressively low levels of fees expected by the client
REVIEW OF BUSINESS AND COMPETITIVE ENVIRONMENT
Any significant industry trends that are likely to impact the client
Any specific issues such as debt leverage / single customer / sole supplier / competition threats
Is the client in a regulated industry subject to policy changes
REVIEW OF FINANCIALS
Do review of financial data indicate any adverse trends that may impact acceptance
Any qualifications in the audit report that merit attention
History of frequent / significant changes in Accounting policies
AUDITOR INDEPENDENCE ASSESSMENT
Independence criteria as laid out in the Companies Act is accomplished
No conflicting services as envisaged in Sec 144 of the Companies Act 2013
There is no Self review threat on account of other services being performed
The firm partner / manager do not hold shares in the entity as prescribed
No close relatives of the partner hold key positions in the entity including directorships
Loans taken / given by the partners vis a vis the entity
Members of the audit team are not employees of the client
Recent pecuniary relationships which may impair independence
Disproportionately large fees from the client vs the total billing of the audit firm
Can the audit be continued in the context of compulsory under Sec 139 of the Companies Act
Any need for partner rotation as the partner has serviced the client for too long
CONFLICT OF INTEREST
Conflict of Interest with any other client of the audit firm
PAST AUDITOR COMMUNICATION
Communication to retiring auditor including reasons for resignation
Adverse replies if any to the above NOC request have been considered properly
HISTORY OF PERSONNEL / PROFESSIONAL CHANGES
Frequent changes in employees / key personnel / directors
Frequent changes in auditors / other professionals of the firm
TEAM COMPETENCE
Does the audit practice team have the relevant skills, experience and specialization, if any required to handle the engagement
